name: pipkin
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small clay pot (= a container for cooking or serving food) with a handle sticking out of the side: Put three salt herrings in a pipkin, fill it with sliced potatoes, and a little water. A preserving kettle of the finest porcelain is best, but if you have nothing better than an earthenware pipkin, use that.
More examplesFewer examplesA pipkin is an earthenware cooking pot used for cooking over direct heat from coals or a wood fire.In the ashpit was a heap of potatoes roasting, and a boiling pipkin of charred bread, which they called coffee.Simple ointment is made by melting in a pipkin by the side of the fire, without boiling, one part of yellow or white wax, and two parts of hog's lard.
